weka.classifiers.collective.meta

Class Chopper

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier
      • weka.classifiers.MultipleClassifiersCombiner
        • weka.classifiers.RandomizableMultipleClassifiersCombiner
          • weka.classifiers.collective.CollectiveRandomizableMultipleClassifiersCombiner
            • weka.classifiers.collective.meta.Chopper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Classifier, CollectiveClassifier, AdditionalMeasureProducer, CapabilitiesHandler, OptionHandler, Randomizable, RevisionHandler, Summarizable

    public class Chopper
extends CollectiveRandomizableMultipleClassifiersCombiner
implements Summarizable
    Collective Classifier that uses one classifier for labeling the test data after training on the train set. The trained classifier determines the distributions for all the instances in the test set and uses the difference between the two confidences (works, therefore, only on two-class-problems) to rank the instances.
    The fold with the highest ranking (biggest difference between the two confidences) is then added to the training set - after the labels have been determined. This new training set is once again input for a classifier (if there are more than two classifiers given, then the classifiers 2 to n are used in turns for training on the newly generated data and classifying the rest of the test data for the next one) which determines once again the distributions for the remaining instances of the test set.

    Valid options are: 

     -F <num>
  Number of folds to chop the ranked test instances into.
  (default 10)
     -cut-off <num>
  Number of folds after which to stop the adding of folds.
  0 means no cut-off at all. (default 0)
     -folds <folds>
  The number of folds for splitting the training set into
  train and test set. The first fold is always the training
  set. With '-V' you can invert this, i.e., instead of 20/80
  for 5 folds you'll get 80/20.
  (default 5)
     -V
  Inverts the fold selection, i.e., instead of using the first
  fold for the training set it is used for test set and the
  remaining folds for training.
     -verbose
  Whether to print some more information during building the
  classifier.
  (default is off)
     -verbose
  Whether to print some more information during building the
  classifier.
  (default is off)
     -S <num>
  Random number seed.
  (default 1)
     -B <classifier specification>
  Full class name of classifier to include, followed
  by scheme options. May be specified multiple times.
  (default: "weka.classifiers.rules.ZeroR")
     -D
  If set, classifier is run in debug mode and
  may output additional info to the console
    Version:
    $Revision: 2019 $
    Author:
    Bernhard Pfahringer (bernhard at cs dot waikato dot ac dot nz), FracPete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a given list of options.

        Valid options are: 

         -F <num>
  Number of folds to chop the ranked test instances into.
  (default 10)
         -cut-off <num>
  Number of folds after which to stop the adding of folds.
  0 means no cut-off at all. (default 0)
         -folds <folds>
  The number of folds for splitting the training set into
  train and test set. The first fold is always the training
  set. With '-V' you can invert this, i.e., instead of 20/80
  for 5 folds you'll get 80/20.
  (default 5)
         -V
  Inverts the fold selection, i.e., instead of using the first
  fold for the training set it is used for test set and the
  remaining folds for training.
         -verbose
  Whether to print some more information during building the
  classifier.
  (default is off)
         -verbose
  Whether to print some more information during building the
  classifier.
  (default is off)
         -S <num>
  Random number seed.
  (default 1)
         -B <classifier specification>
  Full class name of classifier to include, followed
  by scheme options. May be specified multiple times.
  (default: "weka.classifiers.rules.ZeroR")
         -D
  If set, classifier is run in debug mode and
  may output additional info to the console
